evidence.pdf_reference: oxynitrides. The photocatalytic performance of the as-prepared ZnGaNO nanotubes (denoted as ZGNO-nanotube) was conducted by CO 2 photoreduction.Fig. 5a shows that CO 2 can be photoreduced into CH 4 over ZnGaNO nanotubes loaded with 0.5 wt Pt as a co-catalyst in the presence of water vapor under visible light irradiation (420 nm filter).For comparison, the photoreduction performances of ZnGaNO nanoparticles synthesized by the solid state reaction of ZnO and Ga 2 O 3 at 850 C under flowing NH 3 for 15 h

3 h.The surface morphology was characterized by scanning electron microscopy (SEM, FEI Nova Nano SEM 230, USA).TEM images and selected area electron diffraction patterns (SAED) were obtained by employing a transmission electron microscope (TEM, FEI Tecnai G2 F30 S-Twin, USA) operated at 200 kV.The transmission infrared spectra were recorded by Infrared Spectroscopy (FT-IR spectrometer, NEXUS870, Nicolet, USA) under ambient conditions. The photocatalytic CO 2 reaction was carried out in a glass reactor with

The ZnGaNO nanotube was synthesized by nitriding a mixture of the as-prepared ZnO nanorod and Ga 2 O 3 nanosheet at 800 C for 5 h at 500 sccm NH 3 flow, followed by loading 0.5 wt Pt as a cocatalyst by the impregnation method. The ZnGaNO-SSR was synthesized by nitriding a mixture of ZnO and Ga 2 O 3 at 850 C for 15 h, followed by loading 0.5 wt Pt as a cocatalyst by the impregnation method. The crystal phase of the derived sample was determined by using an X-ray diffractometer (XRD, Rigaku Ultima III,

out in a glass reactor with an area of 4.2 cm 2 .The light source was a 300 W xenon arc lamp from PerfectLight Company, and to obtain visible irradiation, a 420 nm filter was employed.The volume of the reaction chamber was about 230 ml.Before the reaction, the chamber was evacuated several times and then high purity CO 2 gas was introduced into the reaction chamber to achieve ambient pressure.0.4 ml deionized water was injected into the chamber as the reactant.During the reaction, 1 ml gas was extracted

higher than 0.033 mol g -1 h -1 for ZGNO-SSR.The ZGNO-nanorod has almost the same activity as the ZGNO-nanotube in the first four hours, and then gradually decreases.Under full-arc light irradiation (Fig. 5b), the CH 4 production rate over ZnGaNO nanotubes was about 0.60 mol g -1 h -1 , about 8 times higher than that under visible light irradiation, probably due to more light absorption and less bulk recombination because of the shorter penetration depth of ultraviolet light. The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.

preparationA ZnO nanorod was synthesized using Zn(NO 3 ) 2 6H 2 O and ammonium hydroxide as precursors.Typically, 2.5 g Zn(NO 3 ) 2 6H 2 O and 1.0 g ammonium hydroxide were added into 100 ml deionized water, and kept in a water bath at 90 C for 4 h.The Ga 2 O 3 nanosheet was synthesized by a hydrothermal ion-exchange reaction followed by dehydration heat treatment.
